name: Vegan Chocoflan
description: Also known as pastel impossible (or impossible cake), choco flan is the fusion of chocolate cake and flan. That’s right! It is then drizzled with cajeta and chopped pecans.

video.name: Vegan Chocoflan
video.description: Rich chocolate cake topped with creamy flan, vegan cajeta, and chopped pecans.

recipeIngredient: 1 can (15 oz.) Full fat coconut milk

recipeInstructions.text: Coat a (10 -12 cup capacity) bundt pan with a little bit of vegan butter or vegetable cooking spray. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Coat a (10 -12 cup capacity) bundt pan with a little bit of vegan butter or vegetable cooking spray. Set aside.

itemListElement.text: Place coconut milk in a medium sauce pot, and bring to a simmer.
itemListElement.name: Place coconut milk in a medium sauce pot, and bring to a simmer.

itemListElement.text: While the milk is heating up, combine the oat milk, cornstarch, sugar, chickpea flour, and vanilla in the blender and process until smooth. Pour this mixture into the pot with the coconut milk. Add food coloring if using, mix to combine.
itemListElement.name: While the milk is heating up, combine the oat milk, cornstarch, sugar, chickpea flour, and vanilla in the blender and process until smooth. Pour this mixture into the pot with the coconut milk. Add food coloring if using, mix to combine.

itemListElement.text: Bring mixture to a simmer for 5 minutes, then remove from the heat, and pour into the bundt pan. Give it a little shake to evenly distribute the flan mixture in the bottom the pan. Set aside.
itemListElement.name: Bring mixture to a simmer for 5 minutes, then remove from the heat, and pour into the bundt pan. Give it a little shake to evenly distribute the flan mixture in the bottom the pan. Set aside.

itemListElement.text: Sift the flour, cocoa powder, sugar, baking soda, and salt into a large bowl and mix to combine. Make a well in the center of your bowl and add the vanilla, oil, vinegar, and water. Whisk until smooth.
itemListElement.name: Sift the flour, cocoa powder, sugar, baking soda, and salt into a large bowl and mix to combine. Make a well in the center of your bowl and add the vanilla, oil, vinegar, and water. Whisk until smooth.

itemListElement.text: Pour cake batter on top of the flan mixture already in the bundt pan.
itemListElement.name: Pour cake batter on top of the flan mixture already in the bundt pan.

itemListElement.text: Place a sheet tray with water in the center rack of the oven (this will function as our water bath) and place bundt pan in the center of the sheet tray. Bake for 45-50 minute or until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean. (Be careful not to insert the toothpick all the way to the bottom of the bundt pan, we just want to test the cake, not the flan).
itemListElement.name: Place a sheet tray with water in the center rack of the oven (this will function as our water bath) and place bundt pan in the center of the sheet tray. Bake for 45-50 minute or until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean. (Be careful not to insert the toothpick all the way to the bottom of the bundt pan, we just want to test the cake, not the flan).

itemListElement.text: Remove cake from the oven and let cool. Place in fridge for at least two hours until it is completely cool. Pass a butter knife around the edges of the bundt pan only at the cake level. Flip the bundt pan over onto a plate and give the bundt pan a shake. The cake should slide out.
itemListElement.name: Remove cake from the oven and let cool. Place in fridge for at least two hours until it is completely cool. Pass a butter knife around the edges of the bundt pan only at the cake level. Flip the bundt pan over onto a plate and give the bundt pan a shake. The cake should slide out.

itemListElement.text: Garnish with vegan cajeta and chopped pecans.
itemListElement.name: Garnish with vegan cajeta and chopped pecans.

keywords: chocolate, flan, vegan cake, vegan dessert
